image.altText: Around 10 cars squeeze into a petrol station to get fuel.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Fina has intensified to a category three system as it moves towards Darwin. Follow live.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Fina intensifies to category three system as it moves towards Darwin

image.altText: Huge reservoirs at an industrial facility, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: A fuel tanker is racing to unload diesel for the Northern Territory as Cyclone Fina approaches.

title.children: Fuel tanker rushed to Darwin Port as Cyclone Fina looms

image.altText: A white woman in a black linen vest and pants, walking out of a building, brown hair tied back.

props.synopsis: Building company director Jessica Buckley is the fourth person charged with fraud over an alleged $71 million Department of Defence contracts scandal.

title.children: Fourth person charged over alleged $71m Defence contracts fraud

image.altText: a mob of cattle in a yard, at sunset. Some cattle are white, others are brown. Brown dirt ground.

props.synopsis: Nicolas Kostowski is ordered to pay hundreds of thousands of dollars in compensation after pleading guilty to stealing 116 cattle from a neighbouring property.

title.children: NT cattle rustler fined almost $430k over theft 'motivated by greed'

image.altText: A close-up of a prison guard's badge.

props.synopsis: The officials who manage the Northern Territory's prison system say a new framework will replace a "fragmented" rehabilitation model that was not based on evidence, as the department moves "from crisis to reform".

title.children: NT prisons set to shift 'from crisis to reform' under new rehabilitation plan

image.altText: An elderly man sits on an armchair, his daughter sits beside him on another chair.

props.synopsis: A 92-year-old man and his daughter are calling for the Department of Housing to install better security at a block of Alice Springs housing commission units, after a series of assaults on elderly residents.

title.children: Calls for security to be 'ramped up' at Alice Springs units

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair sits under a verandah at a table strewn with jars, leaves, flower and photo frames.

props.synopsis: Small business owners in Alice Springs encourage residents to spend at locally owned stores this Christmas to keep money circulating in the community.

title.children: Alice Springs businesses say ditch Temu and Shein to support local stockists

image.altText: Serious Ned has a red band around his forehead, grey beard and moustache, wears an Indigenous-print shirt, background blurred.

props.synopsis: Kumanjayi White investigation continues six months on from his death as the Department of Public Prosecutions awaits "the provision of further material" from NT Police. But the family says the findings are taking too long.

title.children: Death in custody ruling delayed as DPP requests details from NT Police

image.altText: Prawns

props.synopsis: As consumers, it's almost impossible to tell if a label on food is genuine. A small team of scientists are taking on this big problem.

title.children: From fake honey to fake oregano: The mission to fight food fraud

props.synopsis: Australia and the European Union “edging closer” to a free trade deal and a luxury car tax is potentially on the table as a bargaining chip.

title.children: European cars could become cheaper in EU trade deal

image.altText: Mitchell Starc holds a ball up to the crowd walking off the ground

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc's career-best day had Australia on track for a dream Ashes opening, only for England to offer back an ominous warning for the series ahead.

title.children: As Starc reached new heights, Australia copped an Ashes warning

image.altText: Sussan Ley sits in Question Time.

props.synopsis: Labor is trying to keep a low profile while the opposition fends off One Nation and Sussan Ley fights for her job.

title.children: Labor keeps a low profile while the opposition fends off One Nation

image.altText: Composite image of three people killed at Wieambilla in 2022

props.synopsis: The families of constables Matthew Arnold and Rachel McCrow, who died along with neighbour Alan Dare at the deadly 2022 ambush, had hoped for more.

title.children: Families of murdered officers 'disappointed' by Wieambilla inquest findings

image.altText: A delicate yellow orchid flower, on the end of its green stem.

props.synopsis: Australian cemeteries have become a safe haven for flora and fauna affected by urban expansion, including a rare orchid unique to a small patch of the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: Rare orchids and wattles thrive in old cemeteries

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: Two buyer's advocates voice concerns about the Victorian government's proposal to stamp out underquoting at auctions.

title.children: Unexpected criticism for Victoria's reserve price real estate law

image.altText: Liverpool plays Manchester City in Premier League

props.synopsis: Premier League clubs agree to the establishment of spending caps in England's top flight, beginning in the 2026/27 campaign.

title.children: English Premier League to introduce spending cap next season

image.altText: CGI characters Woody, a cowboy doll, and Buzz Lightyear, an astronaut action figure, smile on a bed.

props.synopsis: Toy Story made history as the world's first computer-animated feature film. As it celebrates 30 years, we look back on the cinematic hit that sparked a technological revolution.

title.children: As Toy Story turns 30, we look back on the film that changed animation

image.altText: Question mark and quotation marks hanging from strings

props.synopsis: This week we have some choice words from Dave Grohl, a blob in the sky, a "wee dancer" and an unsuspecting bandicoot.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: Nirvana's set list, a visitor from space, smashed avo and some unsuspecting prey

image.altText: A smiling young Noongar woman lies on her back in green grass, arms crossed above her head and wearing floral print navy dress.

props.synopsis: Connecting language and country with culture and community, Bumpy's beautiful debut album is closing the gap through music.

title.children: Meet Bumpy, the artist behind one of the year's most beautiful albums

image.altText: Parma wallabies eating food on the grass.

props.synopsis: The parma wallaby was thought to be extinct until Peter Pigott followed up on a rumour that a 19th century governor took a bunch of the mammals to New Zealand proved to be true.

title.children: Man's half-century bid to save rare 'snack size' island wallabies

image.altText: 2025-11-17T125307Z_741427822_RC2CYHAFXUU6_RTRMADP_3_UKRAINE-CRISIS-FRANCE-MACRON

props.synopsis: In a sombre address to Ukraine's citizens, the president vowed he would not betray Ukrainian interests in the US-led peace process.

title.children: Ukraine faces 'difficult choice' of losing dignity or US backing, says Zelenskyy

image.altText: Former leader of Reform UK in Wales Nathan Gill

props.synopsis: Nathan Gill, a hard-right British former politician and one-time ally of Reform UK leader Nigel Farage, pleaded guilty earlier to eight counts of bribery between December 2018 and July 2019.

title.children: Former Reform UK politician jailed for taking bribes from pro-Russians

image.altText: The SA flag flies above South Australia's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Four and a half years after a landmark review into sexual harassment, South Australia's Parliament has been accused of moving at a "glacial pace" on workplace reforms, with a new report revealing staff concerns about power imbalances and a "deeply ingrained culture of favouritism".

title.children: Favouritism, fear and double standards: SA Parliament's culture under fire

image.altText: A bearded man, wearing glasses. He is sitting on a blue train seat, looking out the window, he appears serious.

props.synopsis: Victorians will benefit from free public transport on weekends this summer, but not all travellers are excited for the freebie.

title.children: V/Line travel is free on weekends this summer in Victoria but will you find a seat?

image.altText: A young Lebanese man bushwalking.

props.synopsis: A community-led hiking program is introducing migrants to the bush, offering moments of connection, discovery and, for some, a sense of safety.

title.children: The group welcoming refugees with a bushwalk

image.altText: Roma Wilson in front of her Thornton home, wearing flower blouse, holding walking stick, red tape and car destroyed

props.synopsis: A Hunter Valley teenager said he was just in the right place at the right time when he helped a 92-year-old woman to safety as her home was engulfed in flames.

title.children: School student helps 92yo escape home moments before 'massive explosion'

image.altText: People holding Australian flags outside Parliament House in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Sovereign citizens are clogging up Australian courts, after the global financial crisis and COVID-19 spurred a surge in the group's numbers in Australia.

title.children: A growing number of sovereign citizens are clogging up courts

image.altText: Ms Sloane in a blue blazer smiles as she talks into microphones at a media press conference with another woman behind her

props.synopsis: Former shadow health minister Ms Sloane was endorsed by Mr Speakman during a press conference announcing his resignation on Thursday afternoon and elected unopposed this morning.

title.children: New NSW opposition leader says 'we are ready for a fight'

image.altText: Julie Inman Grant is Australia’s eSafety Commissioner stands in her officer in front of windows with her armed crossed

props.synopsis: Less than three weeks out from when the ban is due to come into force, the eSafety Commissioner revealed the platform would join the list of age-restricted social media sites.

title.children: Popular streaming site Twitch to be included in under 16s social media ban

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player poses for the cameras with his premiership medal, kneeling next to his wife and son.

props.synopsis: Adelaide could not satisfy Brisbane in the AFL trade negotiations for Callum Ah Chee, but finally land the target through the pre-season draft.

title.children: Crows land flag star Ah Chee as players earn AFL lifelines

image.altText: A woman and man standing side by side smiling, the man is holding a black Gibson gibson electric guitar.

props.synopsis: Western Australian musician Guy Ghouse dies at the age of 56 after a two year battle with cancer.

title.children: 'There was none better': Renowned WA musician Guy Ghouse dies, aged 56

image.altText: A competitor's car gets airborne during a rally event on open road.

props.synopsis: The tarmac rally returned this year after a three-and-a-half-year hiatus and a major safety overhaul. Organisers say they want to focus more on participants enjoying their cars and the destinations.

title.children: Targa organisers look to early days as rally returns in changed format

image.altText: A female student completes her exam using a laptop.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Assessment, Standards and Certification apologises to students after a fourth error in this year's Tasmanian Certificate of Education exams comes to light.

title.children: Regulator apologises as fourth error reported in Tasmanian exams

image.altText: A politician in a suit and tie, standing in front of a green sign with the Medicare logo.

props.synopsis: Medicare figures quietly published online show bulk-billing has not improved from a year ago, despite billions being tipped into the scheme. As out-of-pocket costs rise, GPs are delivering 10,000 fewer services every day compared to last year.

title.children: GP visits dropping by 10,000 a day, as cost pressures mount

image.altText: Paul Kelly, wearing headphones, smiles and sings into a microphone in studio performance

props.synopsis: Nearly 20 years on from his debut on triple j's long-running covers segment, Paul Kelly and his trusty band take on Australia's queen of pop for their Like A Version comeback.

title.children: Paul Kelly does it again with Kylie Minogue cover for Like A Version
